medical_history.chief_complaint: Difficulty in walking, facial asymmetry, and numbness in both legs.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 6 weeks prior with a sensation of pins and needles in both thighs spreading distally, followed by a left facial droop, with involvement of the right side soon after. There was no change in bladder or bowel function.
medical_history.social_history: No significant exposure to toxins or alcohol misuse. Recently tested HIV negative after starting a new heterosexual relationship with no symptoms of sexually transmitted infections.
